name: Islamic State of Iraq and Syria
identity: A radical militant Sunni group with a goal of establishing a caliphate through violent means and strict interpretation of Islamic law.
description: The primary adversary in the conflict.

name: Iraqi Security Forces
identity: The official military force of Iraq, primarily composed of both Sunni and Shia personnel, dedicated to maintaining law and order and combating insurgency within its borders.
description: The official military and police forces of Iraq.

name: United States and Western Coalition
identity: A coalition of Western nations focused on counter-terrorism and supporting allied forces through advanced military capabilities and economic aid.
description: Includes the US, UK, France, and other Western allies providing airstrikes, special forces, and military support.

name: Kurdish Forces
identity: A regional force, primarily Sunni, seeking autonomy and protection of their ethnic group through both defensive and offensive operations.
description: Includes the Kurdish Peshmerga and Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF), primarily composed of the Kurdish YPG and allied militias.

name: Popular Mobilization Forces
identity: A coalition of predominantly Shia militias with strong religious ties, focusing on expanding influence and supporting allied regional forces.
description: A coalition of predominantly Shia militias, including groups influenced by Muqtada al-Sadr, with Iranian support.

name: Hezbollah
identity: A Shia militant group with strong ideological ties to regional powers, engaged in supporting allies and conducting asymmetric warfare.
description: A Lebanese Shia militant group with a significant role in Syria, often acting as an extension of Iranian influence.

name: Iran
identity: A Shia-majority nation-state with a focus on regional stability and influence, supporting allied groups and engaging in both direct and indirect military actions.
description: Directly supports the ISF, PMF, and other allied groups, including Hezbollah.

name: Syrian Government Forces
identity: A government military force aiming to regain control over contested areas and eliminate insurgent threats with support from international allies. Predominantly Alawite (Shia sect).
description: Led by Bashar al-Assad, supported by Russia and Iran, fighting ISIS within Syria.
